Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on personal freedom of choice.
It assumes that Australian adults cannot discern truth for themselves.
The bill negates independent critical thinking in favor of 'groupthink'.
It creates a culture of fear and censorship, contrary to Australian values.
There is no need for government regulation of social media posts.
The legislation is seen as a control mechanism inappropriate for a democratic country.
The bill poses a threat to freedom of speech and opinions.
Notable Quotes: This bill is an infringement on personal freedom of choice as it presupposes that Australian adults are unable to discern for themselves what is true.
It negates independent critical thinking in favour of 'groupthink', and creates a culture of fear and censorship that is anathema to our Australian way of life.
The only possible reason would be as a control mechanism which is not appropriate legislation in a democratic country founded on the principles of representative government.
